verb.description: Bring (something, especially a product, measure, or concept) into use or operation for the first time.
examples: measures were introduced to help families with children

verb.description: Make (someone) known by name to another in person, especially formally.
examples: I hope to introduce Jenny to them very soon
a device that introduces chlorine into the pool automatically

verb.description: Occur at the start of; open.
examples: a longer, more lyrical opening that introduces her first solo

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense bring (a person) into a place or group): from Latin introducere, from intro- to the inside + ducere to lead.
